Issues.Title: `print` modifiers seem to be lost when print orientation changes
Issues.Body:
I'm trying to use the `print` modifier to hide certain parts of my UI when the user tries to print the page i.e. `print:hidden`.

This preview in the dialogue looks as expected when I first press print. However, if I switch the orientation to landscape, everything seems to become visible again. Switch back to portrait and it's all hidden again.

Any ideas?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`print` modifiers seem to be lost when print orientation changes" (#10174)

Issues.Title: CSS animation not working
Issues.Body: I have made a  custom animation which works perfectly when i throw it against any HTML element as a class, problem starts when i try to add it to a element using JavaScript, like element.classList.add("animation-name"), it does not work? any idea of what i am doing wrong
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "CSS animation not working" (#10171)

Issues.Title: Add logical properties support for inline direction
Issues.Body:
This PR introduces support for [logical properties](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Logical_Properties) in the inline direction for all relevant existing utilities, making it easier to build sites that support LTR and RTL layouts without having to use the `rtl:` variant when you simply need to mirror the styles. | New class | Properties | Physical counterpart (LTR) | | -------------- | -------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------- | | `start-*` | `inset-inline-start` | `left-*` | | `end-*` | `inset-inline-end` | `right-*` | | `ms-*` | `margin-inline-start` | `ml-*` | | `me-*` | `margin-inline-end` | `mr-*` | | `ps-*` | `padding-inline-start` | `pl-*` | | `pe-*` | `padding-inline-end` | `pr-*` | | `rounded-s-*` | `border-start-start-radius`
`border-end-start-radius` | `rounded-l-*` | | `rounded-e-*` | `border-start-end-radius`
`border-end-end-radius` | `rounded-l-*` | | `rounded-ss-*` | `border-start-start-radius` | `rounded-tl-*` | | `rounded-se-*` | `border-start-end-radius` | `rounded-tr-*` | | `rounded-ee-*` | `border-end-end-radius` | `rounded-br-*` | | `rounded-es-*` | `border-end-start-radius` | `rounded-bl-*` | | `border-s-*` | `border-inline-start-width` | `border-l-*` | | `border-e-*` | `border-inline-end-width` | `border-r-*` | | `border-s-*` | `border-inline-start-color` | `border-l-*` | | `border-e-*` | `border-inline-end-color` | `border-r-*` | | `scroll-ms-*` | `scroll-margin-inline-start` | `scroll-ml-*` | | `scroll-me-*` | `scroll-margin-inline-end` | `scroll-mr-*` | | `scroll-ps-*` | `scroll-padding-inline-start` | `scroll-pl-*` | | `scroll-pe-*` | `scroll-padding-inline-end` | `scroll-pr-*` | ## Considerations **This PR is limited to supporting the inline direction only**, as supporting the block direction introduces potential naming collisions that make the API design more challenging, for example is `mb-2` for `margin-bottom` or `margin-block`? After a bunch of research and talking to people in the community, I'm convinced that in practice supporting the block direction has far fewer benefits than supporting the inline direction, so I've opted to support just the inline direction for now to avoid being blocked on the API and get this feature shipped so people can start benefitting from it today. We can always introduce support for the block direction separately in the future — no need for them to be introduced together and slow down the process. Right now we are using the shortest names possible like `ps-*` but if we eventually add block support and feel like that's too ambiguous, we can always support a more verbose version like `p-is-*` so that the block direction equivalent can be `p-bs-*`. My gut is that the block direction stuff will be needed so infrequently that simply making the block direction more verbose and keeping the inline ones terse is actually going to be the better trade-off though. **This PR does not include support for the logical values of `clear` or `float`**, as browser support is currently poor. We can of course revisit this in the future and add them another day when support is better.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add logical properties support for inline direction" (#10166)

Issues.Title: npx tailwindcss .... --watch is locking my files
Issues.Body:
I've installed the latest version of Tailwind (December 2022) and am using this guide : 
https://chrissainty.com/adding-tailwind-css-v3-to-a-blazor-app/

using this command: 
**npx tailwindcss -i ./app.css -o ./wwwroot/css/app.css --watch**

While editing the Blazor files, the Powershell terminal compiles my CSS and is somewhat working fine. 

However - at some point i can't save the Razor / CSHTML files in Visual Studio because the files are locked by NPX / Node 
I then have to close Powershell / Tailwind builder to save my files. 

Ultimately - i would much rather like to work with a pre-compiled subset version of Tailwind but have had a hard time finding the right way to select which features i want. That way i would have functioning Intellisense in Visual Studio.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "npx tailwindcss .... --watch is locking my files " (#10163)

Issues.Title: Styling Not Being Applied in NextJS-13
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/9936
Originally posted by **MattHeslington** November 25, 2022 Hello, I'm experiencing a really strange issue with the experimental version of NextJs13 whereby styling is not being applied despite the rules being present in the static stylesheet. I have tried both the TS and JS implementations of Next, and have tried different browsers too. I've folowed both the instructions on the Tailwind site, and those on the Next site for implementing Tailwind. Nothing has worked correctly. Here we can see a div with 3 Tailwind classes, but only font-bold is being honoured: ![Screenshot 2022-11-25 at 19 17 11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8208896/203975210-7c8343fa-8a51-42a1-af41-4448d7a99948.jpg) I thought that maybe there was an issue with the classes not being compiled, but looking at the static stylesheet, they are there: ![Screenshot 2022-11-25 at 19 16 29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8208896/203975444-53ab2f1f-347c-4749-99cc-09f5fd56704f.jpg) The only way I can get the classes to show is to manually reload or refresh the browser, but obviously this isn' t ideal in a large app. I have raised this in a discussion on the Next repo, but have received no answers as yet. Does anyone know what's causing this, please? Cheers, Matt
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Styling Not Being Applied in NextJS-13" (#10161)

Issues.Title: Drop Node.js 12 from workflows because of EOL
Issues.Body: IDK if this question was already discussed, but since [Node.js 12 entered EOL since 30 April 2022](https://nodejs.org/es/blog/release/v12.22.12/), does the project have a reason to still use it on workflows?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Drop Node.js 12 from workflows because of EOL" (#10153)

Issues.Title: Upgrade postcss-import: 14.1.0 → 15.1.0 (major)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this upgrade. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ✳️ postcss-import (14.1.0 → 15.1.0) · [Repo](https://github.com/postcss/postcss-import) · [Changelog](https://github.com/postcss/postcss-import/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

15.1.0 (from changelog)

  • Add data: URL support (this is not useful for most consumers) (#515)

15.0.1 (from changelog)

  • Preserve layer in ignored @imports (#510, #511)
  • Join media queries in the correct order (#512, #513)

15.0.0 (from changelog)

  • BREAKING: Require Node.js v14+ (#497)
  • BREAKING: Require nameLayer option for handling anonymous layers (#496)
  • Fix handling of @media queries inside layered imports (#495, #496)

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 19 commits:

  • 15.1.0
  • add data url support (#515)
  • 15.0.1
  • Correctly sort media queries before joining them (#513)
  • Preserve layer in ignored import statements (#511)
  • Update dependency prettier to ~2.8.0 (#508)
  • Update test results for PostCSS 8.4.19 (#507)
  • Update dependency ava to v5 (#506)
  • Update dependency eslint-config-problems to v7 (#504)
  • Update tests results for postcss v8.4.17 (#503)
  • 15.0.0
  • Disable package-lock.json
  • Use optional chaining syntax
  • Update dependency ava to v4 (#478)
  • Update eslint & eslint-config-problems (#474)
  • BREAKING: Require Node v14+ (#497)
  • Fix import with layer; add nameLayer option (#496)
  • Update dependency prettier to ~2.7.0 (#494)
  • Update readme with layer example (#489)

Issues.Title: Custom RGBA value formatting error
Issues.Body:
There's friction with some bundlers like esbuild https://github.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2763.
As potential workaround we could use `bg-[rgba(193_195_201/0.7)]` but tailwind doesn't recognize custom bg value in that format.

tailwindcss@3.0.16
esbuild@0.16.10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Custom RGBA value formatting error" (#10138)

Issues.Title: Arbitrary values such as `min-h-[100px]` not working with imports
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v.3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Next.js v13

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v16

**Reproduction URL**

https://codesandbox.io/s/using-tailwind-with-next-js-forked-8urvz8?file=/package.json

**Describe your issue**

It seems that arbitrary values such as `min-h-[100px]` do not work in an environment where tailwind CSS utilities are imported, as opposed to generic utilities such as `min-h-0`. 

In the example I've added above, the arbitrary utility is not recognized, while a generic one targets `min-height: 0` correctly.

I could not reproduce the same issue on the tailwind playground, I suspect it might be related to Nextjs built-in PostCSS support.

Related to #6995.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Arbitrary values such as `min-h-[100px]` not working with imports" (#10130)

Issues.Title: Missing `aria-invalid` selector
Issues.Body:
I am using the latest version of Tailwind and I think `aria-invalid` is missing

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Attributes/aria-invalid
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Missing `aria-invalid` selector" (#10127)

Issues.Title: Trouble building the next web application because of `Fixed-range breakpoints`
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

`v3.2.4`

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

`postcss 8.4.20, Next.js 13.0.7`

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

`v16.14.0`

**What browser are you using?**

`browser independent`

**What operating system are you using?**

`Windows 10 (wsl2)`

**Reproduction URL**

<https://play.tailwindcss.com/jYjWUkCEGc?file=config>

**Describe your issue**

`error - ./node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/loaders/css-loader/src/index.js??ruleSet[1].rules[3].oneOf[11].use[1]!./node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/loaders/postcss-loader/src/index.js??ruleSet[1].rules[3].oneOf[11].use[2]!./styles/globals.css
TypeError: value.match is not a function`

In playtailwindcss:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13795765/208615738-fa8a1c09-14e1-4f97-a36d-8e3744f3b2ce.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Trouble building the next web application because of `Fixed-range breakpoints`" (#10126)

Issues.Title: `prefix` option + `modifier` + `arbitrary variant`: extra prefix is generated for classes inside variant
Issues.Body:
`prefix: "tw-",` + `hover:[&.header-is-scrolled_.menu-list_a]:tw-text-[#FF0000]` generates: ```CSS .hover\:\[\&\.header-is-scrolled_\.menu-list_a\]\:tw-text-\[\#FF0000\].tw-header-is-scrolled .tw-menu-list a:hover { --tw-text-opacity: 1; color: rgb(255 0 0 / var(--tw-text-opacity)); } ``` expected result: ```CSS .hover\:\[\&\.header-is-scrolled_\.menu-list_a\]\:tw-text-\[\#FF0000\].header-is-scrolled .menu-list a:hover { --tw-text-opacity: 1; color: rgb(255 0 0 / var(--tw-text-opacity)); } ``` # [Tailwind Play Link](https://play.tailwindcss.com/kuo2fGhMiZ) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5171262/208573193-a916f1a3-0efc-4064-99a9-f9b33fa8de3f.png) ```HTML
abc<-
abc
abc
abc
abc
abc
abc
abc<-
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`prefix` option + `modifier` + `arbitrary variant`: extra prefix is generated for classes inside variant" (#10125)

Issues.Title: Invert class not working on production
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

postcss 8.4.20, Nuxt.js 2, webpack 4

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v16

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Building**

For build and run on production used this commands:
`nuxt build --modern=server`
`nuxt start --modern=server`

**Problem**

On production `invert` class not working. I think it happens because:
```
    --tw-blur: ;
    --tw-brightness: ;
    --tw-contrast: ;
    --tw-grayscale: ;
    --tw-hue-rotate: ;
    --tw-saturate: ;
    --tw-sepia: ;
    --tw-drop-shadow: ;
```
not generating in production.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30587167/208252199-6c529bda-4505-4415-8358-613821ccc16a.png)

You can check it on this link: https://hire.az/ru/pricing
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Invert class not working on production" (#10108)

Issues.Title: Border Radius Full
Issues.Body:
Border Radius Full with problem
using rounded-l-full rounded-r-lg in tailwind, Border Radius has issues with 9999px At 9999px it can't create a smaller rounded for the other corner, if you just want to insert full on one side or in a corner. The correct one should be 50% in this case. so each corner takes 50% (full)

<!--

👋 Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Border Radius Full" (#10106)

Issues.Title: change rounded-full to use 100vmax
Issues.Body:
<!--

👋 Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
This adjusts the `rounded-full` utility class to use `100vmax` instead of `9999px` to avoid a magic number
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "change rounded-full to use 100vmax" (#10097)

Issues.Title: cqw in arbitrary values
Issues.Body:
Hi

I use Tailwind CSS  v3.2.4

the container query is very popular and I am trying something.

I found this problem: if I use `cqw` units in arbitrary values, they will turn `cqw` into color.

Example:

```
text-[4cqw]
```

Result:

```
.text-\[4cqw\] {
  color: 4cqw;
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "cqw in arbitrary values" (#10080)

Issues.Title: Update list of length units
Issues.Body: Fixes #10080
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Update list of length units" (#10100)

Issues.Title: tauri integration fails
Issues.Body:
### Describe the bug

I think, the problem is, because the processing mechanism of postcss.

I followed the installation instructions of tailwindcss from the webpage https://tailwindcss.com/docs/guides/sveltekit

I get

```
[vite] Internal server error: [postcss] /<abs path to project>/src/routes/+page.svelte?svelte&type=style&lang.css:1:1: Unknown word
  Plugin: vite:css
  File: /<abs path to project>/src/routes/+page.svelte?svelte&type=style&lang.css:1:1
  1  |  <script>
     |   ^
  2  |    import Greet from "$lib/Greet.svelte";
  3  |  </script>

```

### Reproduction

1. Blank install of tauri with svelte & Typescript
2. Adding tailwind described on webpage https://tailwindcss.com/docs/guides/sveltekit

### Expected behavior

We are having here an absolute path from the filesystem.
I suppose, postcss needs an url to attach url parameters on it to parse the css

?svelte&type=style&lang.css:1:1

### Platform and versions

I think any

### Stack trace

```shell
at Input.error (/home/jbc/Work/indi/indi-desktop/node_modules/postcss/lib/input.js:148:16)
      at Parser.unknownWord (/home/jbc/Work/indi/indi-desktop/node_modules/postcss/lib/parser.js:540:22)
      at Parser.other (/home/jbc/Work/indi/indi-desktop/node_modules/postcss/lib/parser.js:164:12)
      at Parser.parse (/home/jbc/Work/indi/indi-desktop/node_modules/postcss/lib/parser.js:72:16)
      at parse (/home/jbc/Work/indi/indi-desktop/node_modules/postcss/lib/parse.js:11:12)
      at new LazyResult (/home/jbc/Work/indi/indi-desktop/node_modules/postcss/lib/lazy-result.js:133:16)
      at Processor.process (/home/jbc/Work/indi/indi-desktop/node_modules/postcss/lib/processor.js:28:14)
      at compileCSS (file:///home/jbc/Work/indi/indi-desktop/node_modules/vite/dist/node/chunks/dep-2285ba4f.js:37647:14)
      at async TransformContext.transform (file:///home/jbc/Work/indi/indi-desktop/node_modules/vite/dist/node/chunks/dep-2285ba4f.js:37121:56)
      at async Object.transform (file:///home/jbc/Work/indi/indi-desktop/node_modules/vite/dist/node/chunks/dep-2285ba4f.js:42569:30)
```


### Additional context

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "tauri integration fails" (#10081)

Issues.Title: LightMode background color still visible with "darkMode: class" config
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

vite 4.0.1, react 18.2.0

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v16.16.0

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome, Brave

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://github.com/pingustar/tailwind-bug-reproduction

**Describe your issue**

When using `darkMode: "class"` in my tailwind config, the light mode background color is still visible on dark mode.

Even when setting `min-h-screen` to `html, body, #root`, the scroll bounce unveils the light mode background color.

When using `darkMode: "media"` in my tailwind config, everything works as expected.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7262066/207910629-b0dda33b-0cd1-4c1b-9f99-90a0fbb758f1.mov
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "LightMode background color still visible with "darkMode: class" config" (#10094)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Reversed order when using numbers as breakpoints" (#10092)

Issues.Title: Tailwind randomly fails using Elixir on Ubuntu 22.04 and esbuild.
Issues.Body:
I would like to give context  but I have no idea what this error even means or how to even begin diagnosing it.   Seems like a bug.

TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'insertAfter')
    at Root.after (/snapshot/tailwindcss/node_modules/postcss/lib/node.js:161:17)
    at partitionRules (/snapshot/tailwindcss/lib/lib/partitionApplyAtRules.js:47:18)
    at /snapshot/tailwindcss/lib/lib/partitionApplyAtRules.js:54:9

    at LazyResult.runOnRoot (/snapshot/tailwindcss/node_modules/postcss/lib/lazy-result.js:337:23)

    at async build (/snapshot/tailwindcss/lib/cli/build/index.js:42:9)

Issues.Title: hover:invisible flickers
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

postcss-cli 8.4.19, React 18.2.0, webpack 5.74.0

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v16.18.0

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/cYna6e5GU2

**Describe your issue**

The content flickers between visible and invisible. If instead of changing visibility with hover, I change bg-color its okay

https://play.tailwindcss.com/bbMfgH9r5I
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "hover:invisible flickers" (#10077)

Issues.Title: Drop shadow glitch in safari
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
v3.2.4

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v16.17.0

**What browser are you using?**
Safari 16.2, Firefox 107.0.1

**What operating system are you using?**
macOS

**Reproduction URL**
https://play.tailwindcss.com/e9KZZWyoym

**Describe your issue**
Drop shadow on buttons glitch. Any translation transitions or animation seem to make it glitch, but removing overflow-hidden class fixes the issue
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Drop shadow glitch in safari" (#10078)
